original: AMENDMENT NO. 2 TO MANUFACTURING AND SUPPLY AGREEMENT THIS AMENDMENT NO. 2 (this “ Amendment ”) to the Manufacturing and Supply Agreement dated as of December 8, 2009 (as amended by an amendment agreement dated 31 December 2013) (the “ Existing Agreement ”), by and between Columbia Laboratories, (Bermuda) Ltd. , a limited company existing and organised under the laws of Bermuda, having a place of business at Canon’s Court, 22 Victoria Street, Hamilton HM12, Bermuda (“ Columbia ”), and Fleet Laboratories Limited , a limited private company existing and organised under the laws of England, having a place of business at 94 Rickmansworth Road, Watford Herts, WD18 7JJ, United Kingdom (“Fleet ”) is entered into on 2018 (the “ Effective Date ”).
ollama_generated:
ALTERATION NUMBER 2 TO THE MANUFACTURING AND SUPPLY AGREEMENT

This ALTERATION NUMBER 2 (hereinafter referred to as this "Alteration"), supplements the Manufacturing and Supply Agreement originally executed on December 8, 2009 (as amended by an amendment agreement dated December 31, 2013) (collectively, the "Original Agreement"), between Columbia Laboratories, (Bermuda) Ltd., a limited company incorporated under Bermudian law, with its principal place of business at Canon’s Court, 22 Victoria Street, Hamilton HM12, Bermuda ("Columbia"), and Fleet Laboratories Limited, a private limited company incorporated under English law, with its principal place of business at 94 Rickmansworth Road, Watford Herts, WD18 7JJ, United Kingdom ("Fleet"). This Alteration is effective as of the date hereinafter defined (the "Effective Date").

In contrast to the original agreement, Fleet Laboratories Limited will now bear primary responsibility for any disputes arising from this Alteration, and Columbia Laboratories will no longer be obliged to initiate or participate in dispute resolution processes. This change aims to streamline and simplify the handling of any potential conflicts that may arise under this agreement's terms.

original: ““Batch ” means a quantity of [***] kilograms of material (or such other quantity as the Parties may agree in writing from time to time) produced in a process or series of processes that is expected to be homogeneous within specified limits.” 3. The following shall be added to Section 2.1 of the Existing Agreement (Regulatory Requirements) as a new Section 2.1 (d):
ollama_generated:
"The term "Batch" refers to a quantity, subject to modification in writing by both Parties at any given time, of [***] kilograms or more of material, which may not be strictly homogeneous but is expected to conform to the specified limits of variability."

In regards to Section 2.1 of the Current Agreement (Regulatory Requirements), a new subsection 2.1 (d) will be introduced as follows:

"(d) The expectation for batch uniformity is now modified to accommodate a certain degree of variance within the specified limits, acknowledging that such products may exhibit variability."

original: “2.1 (d) Subject to the prior written consent of Columbia (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned), Fleet may subcontract all or part of the activities to be performed by it under this Agreement to any subcontractor provided that the subcontracting of any activities shall not relieve Fleet of, and Fleet shall remain solely liable for, its obligations under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
2.1 (d) Columbia's prior written approval is required before Fleet can delegate all or part of its duties under this Agreement to a third party. However, such approval should not be withheld unnecessarily, nor delayed excessively, and shall not impose undue conditions. It is understood that while delegation occurs, Fleet will still be fully responsible for fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement, and the delegated subcontractor's performance will be considered as if it were Fleet's own.

In this version, the clause suggests that Columbia should not unnecessarily withhold approval for delegation, nor delay the process excessively, implying a slightly more lenient approach to the approval process compared to the original clause. Additionally, the responsibility for fulfilling obligations under this Agreement remains solely with Fleet, regardless of any delegation or subcontracting.

original: 3A.9 Columbia  shall not be liable for any loss or damage due to the negligence or wilful misconduct of Fleet, its Affiliates, employees, contractors or representatives. In the event of any loss or damage of any item of the Columbia Equipment due to the negligence or wilful misconduct (including negligence or intentional misconduct in relation to the operation, inspection or maintenance of the Columbia Equipment) of Fleet, its Affiliates, employees, contractors or representatives, Fleet shall repair or replace such items of Columbia Equipment, at Fleet’s sole cost and expense, promptly taking into account the quantities of stock held by Fleet at the time of such loss or damage.” 8. Section 3.1 of the Existing Agreement (Production Schedules) shall be deleted and replaced by the following:
ollama_generated:
3A.9. Fleet will not bear any liability for losses or damages arising from Columbia's negligence or intentional misconduct, as well as that of its Affiliates, employees, contractors, or representatives. In the unfortunate event of any damage to any Columbia Equipment resulting from Columbia's negligence or intentional misconduct (encompassing negligence or deliberate misconduct during operation, inspection, or maintenance of the Columbia Equipment), Columbia shall assume responsibility for promptly repairing or replacing such items at its own expense and without undue delay, considering the quantities of stock held by Columbia at the time of such damage.

In lieu of Section 3.1 of the Previous Agreement (Production Schedules), the following section will be inserted:

8. Section 3.1 of the Existing Agreement (Production Schedules) shall be revised and superseded by the following:

Fleet shall establish the production schedules in accordance with its business needs and operational capabilities, with Columbia having a right to request modifications to these schedules subject to Fleet's approval. Such requests must be made in writing at least 30 days prior to the proposed effective date of any schedule modification. Fleet will endeavor to accommodate Columbia's reasonable production schedule requests; however, Fleet reserves the right to deny such requests if they conflict with Fleet's business interests or operational constraints.

original: 5.2 Invoicing. Upon delivery of Product to Columbia, Fleet shall submit invoices therefor to Columbia. Columbia shall pay each invoice in full within [***] after the date of receipt by Columbia of such invoice, which shall be issued no earlier than the date on which the Product is delivered to the carrier by Fleet. All payments shall be made in pounds sterling. In the event that any actual volume of Product purchased by Juniper in any calendar year means that a different purchase price should have applied to such volume of Product purchased in that calendar year (as calculated in accordance with the pricing model set out in Exhibit A ), Fleet shall notify Juniper in writing of such pricing differential and shall apply a proportionate credit or debit (as applicable) to any invoices raised for the subsequent calendar year. 5.2 Invoice Submission and Payment. Upon receipt of acknowledgment from Columbia that the Product has been received, Fleet will issue an invoice for such delivery. Columbia shall make payment for each invoice in full within [***] days after the date of the invoice issuance, provided that the invoice is issued no later than 30 days following the delivery of the Product to the carrier by Fleet. All payments will be made in pounds sterling. If the actual volume of Product purchased by Juniper in any calendar year results in a different purchase price for such volume (as calculated according to the pricing model outlined in Exhibit A), Fleet will adjust subsequent invoices proportionately, either crediting or debiting the amount as necessary. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, certain confidential portions of this exhibit have been omitted and replaced with "[***]". A complete version of this exhibit has been filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission under a request for confidential treatment in accordance with Rule 24B-2 promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for invoicing has been shifted from Columbia to Fleet, while the payment terms have remained the same. Additionally, the payment deadline is now triggered by the invoice issuance date instead of the delivery date. The rest of the clause remains largely unchanged.

original: Fleet shall determine the applicable purchase price for that calendar year and shall notify Juniper in writing of any underpayment or overpayment within [***] of expiration or termination (as applicable). ollama_generated:
12. Section 8 of the Existing Agreement (Insurance) shall be amended as follows:

Fleet is granted the discretion to establish the applicable purchase price for the calendar year, and Juniper will be informed in writing of any discrepancies regarding overpayments or underpayments within [***] following the expiration or termination (as applicable). In instances where Juniper has made an overpayment, Fleet shall rectify this by returning the excess amount to Juniper within [***] of receiving written notice. If a shortfall in payment by Juniper is identified, no immediate action will be required from Juniper, and the matter will be resolved through good-faith negotiations between the parties. Juniper's cooperation and active participation are essential for resolving any discrepancies promptly and equitably. Fleet shall grant Columbia access to all necessary books and records within a reasonable timeframe to facilitate verification of any adjustments made to the purchase price or any underpayment or overpayment.

original: “Fleet and Columbia shall maintain comprehensive general liability insurance, including product liability insurance against claims regarding the manufacture of Product under this Agreement and sufficient cover to meet its liabilities under this Agreement in respect of the Columbia Equipment, with insurers having an AM Best rating within the top 2 categories at the time (at the date of this Agreement known as “superior” or “excellent”) or reasonably comparable coverage, in such amounts as it customarily maintains for similar products and activities, but in no event less than [***] per individual claim and [***] in the aggregate. Section 10.1 (a) of the Existing Agreement (Fleet’s Indemnity Obligations) shall be deleted and replaced by the following:
modified:
"Upon mutual agreement, Fleet and Columbia may elect to carry comprehensive general liability insurance, including product liability insurance against claims concerning the production of Product under this Agreement, with insurers having an AM Best rating within the top 2 categories at the time (at the date of this Agreement known as “superior” or “excellent”) or reasonably comparable coverage. The coverage shall be sufficient to meet their liabilities under this Agreement in respect of the Columbia Equipment, but neither party is obligated to maintain insurance amounts exceeding [***] per individual claim and [***] in the aggregate. Either party may elect to forgo such insurance during the Term and thereafter, provided that they continue to insure themselves for similar products and activities (but in no event less than [***] following termination or expiration).

In lieu of Section 10.1 (a) of the Existing Agreement (Fleet’s Indemnity Obligations), the following shall apply:

(a) Each party will be responsible for any third-party claims arising from their respective negligent acts or omissions under this Agreement, except in cases where such acts or omissions are caused by the other party's intentional misconduct. This obligation will persist beyond the termination or expiration of this Agreement."

original: “12.2 (b) Columbia shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon [***] notice to Fleet in the event:

This modification keeps the right of termination with Fleet but changes the initial condition from Columbia having the right to terminate to Fleet having the discretion to do so. The phrase "upon [***] notice" has been replaced with "following written notification" to provide a more specific and professional tone.

original: (b) A material breach of this Section 13.13 shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement. In the event of a material breach of this Section 13.13, the party not in breach shall have the right to terminate this Agreement, without any liability to the party in breach, with immediate effect.
modified: (b) A non-material violation of Section 13.13 may be considered a material breach of this Agreement. In the event of a perceived non-material breach of this Section 13.13, the non-breaching party retains the discretion to provide written notice and allow a reasonable cure period. If the breaching party fails to remedy the violation within such period, or if the non-breaching party determines that the violation is material in nature, then the non-breaching party shall have the option to terminate this Agreement, with no liability accruing to either party for such termination, effective as of the date of notice.

original: (c) This Agreement is made subject to any restrictions concerning the export of products or technical information from the United Kingdom or other countries which may be imposed upon or related to Fleet or Columbia from time to time. Each party agrees that it shall not export, directly or indirectly, any technical information acquired from the other party under this Agreement or any products using such technical information to a location or in a manner that at the time of export requires an export licence or other governmental approval, without first obtaining the written consent to do so from the appropriate agency or other governmental entity.” 25. All other terms and conditions of the Existing Agreement remain in full force and effect. Except as expressly provided in this Amendment, the Existing Agreement shall remain unmodified and is hereby ratified and affirmed. In all other aspects, the existing terms and conditions of this Agreement shall remain binding. This Amendment does not modify any terms and conditions of the Existing Agreement unless explicitly stated herein. The execution, delivery, and effectiveness of this Amendment will not serve as a waiver of any rights, powers, or remedies held by either Columbia or Fleet under the Existing Agreement, except where explicitly provided in this document.
